page.title: 02The Village Of Orlingbury
page.content: The village of Orlingbury is situated 5 kilometres outside the town of Wellingborough.The area surrounding the village is mainly agricultural farmland .Much of the land is used for the growing of cereal crops,But some of the land is used for keeping cattle and sheep. Most people who live in the village work in Wellingborough and travel to work daily by private car.There are a number of doctors living in the village but none of them has a surgery in Orlingbury. There is no industry other than farming. In the centre of the village is the Green which has in it's centre a well. Today this well is no longer used as it has a concrete cap over it.It was capped because a man when collecting water from the well fell down and died.
